intro: Toxicoscordion intermedium, commonly known as the Indian arrowroot, is a member of the Amaranthaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to the Americas, particularly found in regions of the southern United States and parts of Mexico. The plant produces small, greenish flowers and has a distinctive, swollen root system that resembles a bulb. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. However, it is important to note that this plant is toxic and should not be consumed or handled without proper caution.
